p1: This diagram shows that three very popular messengers are actually part of one and the same parent company: Facebook.
p2: This means that the monthly active users combined create an even more dominant role - e.g. in the data and advertising market.
p3: The area represents the data. The size of each square represents a value per entity in specific units.
p4: Monthly active users (MAU) are an indicator for the user base and level of activity, mainly used in the context of advertising. Each company might have a different way (and reason) to measure it. We are looking at a cross-section of data from 2020/21 here which is not complete, but still gives a sense of the role in the market.
